intro: Tragia discolor f. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate tragia, is a variant of the species Tragia discolor, which belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae. This plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves, which are typically green and slightly hairy. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. It is an annual or short-lived perennial herb that thrives in warm, sunny environments.
